Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: ZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the producing zone (formation) of the well.
Column Comment.3: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.4: PAYZONE TYPE: The type of payzone: production or pay.
Column Comment.5: FLUID TYPE: The type of fluid or substance produced by a well or used for variousoperations. For example oil, gas, mud or water. NOTE: The reference tableassociated with this column is still being evaluated for possible subtyping.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the formationinterval.
Column Comment.8: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.9: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: GAS OIL CONTACT DEPTH: This is the depth to the boundary between the gas andoil in the wellbore.
Column Comment.13: GAS OIL CONTACT DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.14: GAS WATER CONTACT DEPTH: This is the depth to the boundary between the gasand water in the wellbore.
Column Comment.15: GAS WATER CONTACT DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.16: GROSS PAY: Value for the total thickness of the pay zone, including non-producingportions, within a specified overall formation interval.
Column Comment.17: GROSS PAY OUOM: Gross pay zone thickness original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: NET PAY: Value for the cumulative thickness of reservoir rock capable of producingcommercial hydrocarbons within a pay zone.
Column Comment.19: NET PAY OUOM: Net pay zone thickness original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: OIL WATER CONTACT DEPTH: This is the depth to the boundary between the oiland water in the wellbore.
Column Comment.21: OIL WATER CONTACT DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.22: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.25: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the formation interval.
Column Comment.26: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
